conclusion: Liquid will flow out from openings A, B, and C and pass through baffles to reach containers D, E, or F.
Opening A is pink and located at the top left of the image.
Opening B is green and located at the top center of the image.
Opening C is blue and located at the top right of the image.
Container D is cyan and located at the bottom left of the image.
Container E is light blue and located next to container D.
Container F is green and located next to container E.
There are baffles in the image: white, black, yellow, and blue, positioned diagonally.
Flow from opening A will hit the white baffle and be directed towards container E.
Flow from opening B will hit the yellow baffle and be directed towards container F.
Flow from opening C will hit the blue baffle and be directed towards container D.
Flow that enters at opening A ends up in container E.
Flow that enters at opening B ends up in container F.
Flow that enters at opening C ends up in container D.
